Sorry for the tweetstorm, but credits are super important. Seeing your work online without appropriate names next to it is infuriating‚Ä¶
8/ Do yourself and others a favor, credit team members appropriately, even if you were the key/main person leading the product.
7/ Just like products wouldn't happen without other team members who worked with you, closely or not, and who surely influenced you.
6/ Would these movies happen without all these people? They wouldn't.
5/ Think about movies where everyone gets credited, from directors, to assistants, to people giving out water bottles to the staff.
4/ B/c we all know products aren't made by one single incredibly versatile genius. Chances are, tens of people are actually involved.
3/ By not crediting, you disrespect your team and won't appear as a team player to others interested in potentially working with you.
2/ Not only those who did prod. work but also those who were part of the broader initiative, even if they're not working with you anymore.
1/ Product designers: be honest and fair to your team, make sure to properly credit others when showing your work online.
